channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The damaged package was found on the unload roller line at door 11. QA went over with proper PPE, hazmat bucket and bag. Once QA contained the package, it was found that all four out of four batteries leaked. QA is unsure where the damage is and what caused it.

item.title: Report E-2024060687
item.description:
Report E-2024060687

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-30
  • City: NICHOLS
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6550
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC driver arrived at the customer location and was preparing to initiate the delivery. It appears that a valve on the trailer was left in a partially open position. When the driver removed the discharge cap approximately 10 gallons of Bonderite C-IC was released. A portion of the spilled product sprayed on the driver and resulted in him seeking medical treatment. T&R Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report I-2024060054
item.description:
Report I-2024060054

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T00:36:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-24
  • City: WATERTOWN
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Christman Fuel Service Inc
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 468000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver took eyes off road, went of shoulder in a curve and rolled over in a vacant field. During rollover the over fill device installed in top of tanker was broken off allowing diesel to leak out of the hole. Manway/dome cover lids were struck and caused to partially open, allowing diesel to leak.

item.title: Report X-2024061877
item.description:
Report X-2024061877

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-22
  • City: RONKONKOMA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE SHIPMENT WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING DURING SORT OPERATIONS. INNER CONTENTS: 1 PLASTIC DRUM SURROUNDED BY STYROFOAM PEANUTS, LEAKING FROM THE TOP. APPROXIMATELY 500ML LEAKED. REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM AND HELD PENDNG DISPOSITION FROM THE SHIPPER
